separationAtPassArrived.description: The separation between the nearest defender and this receiver when the pass arrives to the receiver. Note: if the pass never arrives (due to an overthrown ball for example), then this value will default to the separation at the pass outcome of the play (either caught, incomplete, interception)

separationAtPassCaught.description: The separation between the nearest defender and this receiver when the pass was caught

separationAtPassForward.description: The separation between the nearest defender and this receiver when the pass is thrown by the QB

expectedYardsAfterCatch.description: This is a expectation for YAC based on an ML model leveraging tracking data, calculated at the time the pass is caught.

computedYardsAfterCatch.description: The YAC based on computing yards gained after the pass caught event

separationToQb.description: the distance of the defender to the QB at the time of passForward or if there is a sack, the at the time of a sack or fumble

playState.description: There are 4 states - NGS_GENERATED, UNOFFICIAL, AUDITED, APPROVED. NGS_GENERATED refers to an initial set of play stats generated by the NGS Platform UNOFFICIAL refers to the initial data when a play first comes in AUDITED refers to when we've attached a more exact series of events to the play APPROVED is when the play has been manually validated and approved

isBigPlay.description: A big play is determined by the following conditions: All touchdowns, all Interceptions, rushes > 20 yards, receptions > 20 yards, 30+ yards punt return, 45+ yards kick returns, or 4th down stops

actualYardsToGo.description: The yards to go for a first down, as computed via tracking data, to the nearest 0.01. Note that this will differ slightly from the provided "yardsToGo" because of the tracking data based calculation.

actualYardlineForFirstDown.description: The yardline in the NGS coordinate system to get a first down, computed via tracking data. This is to the nearest 0.01.

health.description: Data quality info around the play
health.title: Health

isOk.description: Whether the data quality for players is ok on the play. Note: this is a somewhat subjective flag that can range from a player missing completely to having slightly bad tracking data.
Whether the data quality for the ball is ok on the play. Note: this is a somewhat subjective flag that can range from not having ball data at all to having irregular ball tracking.

PlayerPositionData.title: PlayerPositionData

isOnField.description: Returns whether or not the player is on the field for the given timestamp. Note that if the API takes in a playId, then this value will be true for any participant on the play, regardless of whether he is in the bounds of the field

a.description: Directional acceleration in yards/second/second. This looks at change in direction along with change in speed for it's calculation. I.e. if 2 players are moving with constantly increasing speed, but one in a straight line and the other changing directions - they will have difference acceleration values.

sa.description: Acceleration in yards/second/second. This is a pure function of change in speed over time. I.e. if 2 players are moving with constantly increasing speed, but one in a straight line and the other changing directions - they will have the same acceleration values. Furthermore, if a player is slowing down, then the value will become negative

o.description: Orientation: The angle in degrees in which the player is facing (i.e. If a player is running forwards, the orientation and direction values should be relatively close. If a player is running completely backwards, the difference should be near 180 degrees)

dir.description: Direction: The angle in degrees in which the player is moving

dqi.description: A value from 0-1 that reflects the quality of this individual tracking data.

dirLoad.description: A load value scaled from -100 to 100 indicating power in the direction a player is moving.

latLoad.description: A load value scaled from -100 to 100 indicating power laterally from the direction of players movement.

NearestDefenderTargetData.title: NearestDefenderTargetData
NearestDefenderTargetData.description: Play information for when the receiver is targeted

penaltyYards.description: The net penalty yards of the play from the offensive perspective

ballOnHash.description: Which hash the ball was on at snap - one of LEFT, RIGHT, BETWEEN

touchdowns.description: The touchdowns are a sum of recieving and rushing touchdowns. This excludes sepecial teams touchdowns

successRate.description:
The success rate of either achieved (if type is offense) or allowed (if type is defense) for this particular personnel. This is calculated by looking at the number of successful plays out of all plays ran in this personnel.
A successful play is based on the down, yards gained, and yards to go - if a play is ran on 1st down and the yards gained was at least 40% of the yards to go, then it was successful. If a play is ran on 2nd down, and the yards gained was at least 50% of the yards to go, then it was successful. For both 3rd and 4th down, if the yards gained was 100% or more of the yards to go, then it was successful.

countPerformance.description: Whether this player had bad tracking data quality during the course of the play. If null or true, the quality of the data is ok, otherwise the quality is bad

pressureCausedTurnover.description: Set only on defensive players. When a defender gets a pressure on the play and the QB commits a turnover (either a strip sack/fumble or an INT), then this will be true

passDefended.description: When GSIS credits the player with a pass defensed, this flag will be true

hurriedQb.description: Over the course from snap to pass forward, when a defender gets within 1.5 yards of the QB, this will be set as true

timeToQbHurry.description: When a play results in a hurry, this field will be the number of seconds it took for the hurry to happen

dropBackType.description: A string constant for player lined as QB for pass, sack and qb rush plays. Can be one of ["TRADITIONAL","DESIGNED_ROLLOUT","SCRAMBLE","UNKNOWN", "SCRAMBLE_ROLLOUT","DESIGNED_ROLLOUT_LEFT","DESIGNED_ROLLOUT_RIGHT", "SCRAMBLE_ROLLOUT_LEFT","SCRAMBLE_ROLLOUT_RIGHT","DESIGNED_RUN","QB_DRAW","ROLLOUT]

timeInTackleBox.description: The amount of time the QB spent in the tackle box. This will always be set on passing plays, with a theoretical max of the QB's time to throw.

hurry.description: If any player got within 1.5 yards of the QB before he threw the ball, this will be true, otherwise false

timeToHurry.description: If the play was a hurry, this will be the earliest time a defender got the hurry.

eventId.description: A unique identifier for the event in a game

name.description: The event name defined by the NGS Glossary

offset.description: The offset, in +/- ,s, from video time to tracking data time

isZeroPoint.description: Indicate that the event is a zero point in the video

type.description: The source type of the event "video_ge"

comment.description: Comment, if any, to go along with the event

time.description: The time of the event calculated based off of the zeroPoint offset

streamStartOffset.description: The offset for start of stream

videoUrl.description: A unique URL to the video stream

startingOffset.description: The offset, in seconds, to the starting point in the video stream

startEventTime.description: This is the first event in the play, usually a huddle or line set

startPlayTime.description: This is the first event during play time, typically the snap or kickoff

endPlayTime.description: This is the last event during play time, effectively when the whistle is blown and the play is dead

endEventTime.description: This is the last event in the play. This accounts for situations where penalties or other non-play events occur after the whistle

gameEventSource.description: We pull events from different sources, 'video' is based on frame by frame video analysis, while 'zebra' is what is sent from the venue

CleanedSubmittedPlay.description: The submitted play for a play. This acts as a time bound for when the play starts/stops, as well as the snap and whistle of the play. This particular model has updated keys that are a little clearer
CleanedSubmittedPlay.title: CleanedSubmittedPlay

start.description: This is the first event in the play, usually a huddle or line set

playStart.description: This is the first event during play time, typically the snap or kickoff

playEnd.description: This is the last event during play time, effectively when the whistle is blown and the play is dead

end.description: This is the last event in the play. This accounts for situations where penalties or other non-play events occur after the whistle

gameEventSource.description: We pull events from different sources, 'video' is based on frame by frame video analysis, while 'zebra' is what is sent from the venue

seasonType.description: The seasonType or seasonTypes separated by ',' (ie. 'REG' or 'REG,POST')

week.description: The week or range separated by '-' or starting with '<' or '>' (ie. 3 or <4 or 2-3)

quarter.description: The quarter. Can be a range separated by '-' or starting with '<' or '>' (ie. 3 or <4 or 2-3)

passPlays.description: The count of pass and sack plays that this entity participated in

rushPlays.description: The count of rush plays that this entity participated in

successRate.description:
The success rate of either achieved (if type is offense) or allowed (if type is defense) for this particular personnel. This is calculated by looking at the number of successful plays out of all plays ran in this personnel.
A successful play is based on the down, yards gained, and yards to go - if a play is ran on 1st down and the yards gained was at least 40% of the yards to go, then it was successful. If a play is ran on 2nd down, and the yards gained was at least 50% of the yards to go, then it was successful. For both 3rd and 4th down, if the yards gained was 100% or more of the yards to go, then it was successful.

The success rate of either achieved (if type is offense) or allowed (if type is defense) for this particular personnel. This is calculated by looking at the number of successful plays out of all plays ran in this personnel.
A successful play is based on the down, yards gained, and yards to go - if a play is ran on 1st down and the yards gained was at least 40% of the yards to go, then it was successful. If a play is ran on 2nd down, and the yards gained was at least 50% of the yards to go, then it was successful. For both 3rd and 4th down, if the yards gained was 100% or more of the yards to go, then it was successful.

expectedRushYards.description: The expected rush yards the ball carrier is expected to gain

expectedRushYardsLower.description: The expected rush yards the ball carrier is expected to gain.  Lower bound of the prediction distribution obtained from dropouts. An experimental feature.

expectedRushYardsUpper.description: The expected rush yards the ball carrier is expected to gain.  Upper bound of the prediction distribution obtained from dropouts. An experimental feature.

expectedRushYardsWidth.description: Difference between upper and lower bounds. This width represents the spread of the prediction distribution.  An experimental feature that describes the confidence of the model by looking at the spread of the prediction distribution. The narrower the spread, the less variation in the predictions (leading to a more confident predictions).

winProbBeforeNextDown.description: The win probability of the current play

winProbAfterFirstDownConv.description: The win probability if the next play ends in a first down conversion

winProbAfterSuccessfulFG.description: The win probability if the next play ends in a successful field goal

winProbAfterTurnoverOnDowns.description: The win probability if the next play ends in a turnover on downs

winProbAfterPunt.description: The win probability if the next play ends in a punt

expectedPtsBeforeNextDown.description: The expected points of the current play

expectedPtsAfterFirstDownConv.description: The expected points if the next play ends in a first down conversion

expectedPtsAfterSuccessfulFG.description: The expected points if the next play ends in a successful field goal

expectedPtsAfterTurnoverOnDowns.description: The expected points if the next play ends in a turnover on downs

expectedPtsAfterPunt.description: The expected points if the next play ends in a punt

probOfSuccessfulFG.description: The probability of making a field goal for the next play

probOfFirstDownConvPass.description: The probability of a first down conversion by passing for the next play

probOfTurnoverOnDownsPass.description: The probability of a turnover by passing for the next play

expectedYardsGainedPass.description: The expected yards gained by passing for the next play

probOfFirstDownConvRush.description: The probability of a first down conversion by rushing for the next play

probOfTurnoverOnDownsRush.description: The probability of a turnover by rushing for the next play

expectedYardsGainedRush.description: The expected yards gained by rushing for the next play

probOfFirstDownConv.description: The probability of a first down conversion regardless of pass or rush for the next play. This probability the combination of weighted probabilities of a pass and rush as follows: probabilityOfPlayTypePass * conversionProbability + probabilityOfPlayTypeRush * conversionProbability

probOfTurnoverOnDowns.description: The probability of a turnover regardless of pass or rush for the next play. This is calculated as: 1 - probOfFirstDownConv

expectedYardsGained.description: The expected yards gained regardless of pass or rush for the next play. This expectation is the combination of weighted probabilities of a pass and rush as follows: probabilityOfPlayTypePass * expectedYards + probabilityOfPlayTypeRush * expectedYards;

fieldGoalExpectedValue.description: The expected value of a field goal being made summed with the expected value of a field goal failing and the possession being turned over as follows: probOfSuccessfulFG * winProbAfterSuccessfulFG + (1 - probOfSuccessfulFG) * winProbAfterTurnoverOnDowns);

goForItPassExpectedValue.description: The expected value of the win probability when going for it by passing. The formula is as follows: probOfFirstDownConvPass * winProbAfterFirstDownConv + probOfTurnoverOnDownsPass * winProbAfterTurnoverOnDowns

goForItRushExpectedValue.description: The expected value of the win probability when going for it by rushing. The formula is as follows: probOfFirstDownConvRush * winProbAfterFirstDownConv + probOfTurnoverOnDownsRush * winProbAfterTurnoverOnDowns

goForItExpectedValue.description: The expected value of the win probability when going for it regardless of pass or rush. The formula is as follows: probOfFirstDownConv * winProbAfterFirstDownConv + probOfTurnoverOnDowns * winProbAfterTurnoverOnDowns

recommendation.description: The recommendation based on the hypothetical outcomes

passProbability.description: The historical probability of a play being a pass based on the yards to go

rushProbability.description: The historical probability of a play being a rush based on the yards to go

coachDecision.description:
The coach's decision for the play we are recommending.
Fake field goal or punt will be considered coach's decision = GO_FOR_IT.
Aborted field goal will still be coach's decision = FIELD_GOAL. Similarly for punt.

playType.description:
The play type of the play after what actually happened.
Not played out penalty no plays like False Start and Defensive Offsides will have playType=PENALTY.
If decision = GO_FOR_IT, it'll be one of [PASS, RUSH, PENALTY].
If decision = PUNT, it'll be one of [PUNT, PENALTY].
If decision = FIELD_GOAL, it'll be one of [FIELD_GOAL, PENALTY].

playOutcome.description:
The outcome of the play after what actually happened.
If it's a no play penalty that results in a redo of the play, playOutcome = PENALTY.
If decision = GO_FOR_IT, it'll be one of [SUCCESS, FAIL, PENALTY] where success = converting first down. A penalty
that results in a first down for offense such as Defensive Pass Inteference will have playOutcome = SUCCESS.
If decision = FIELD_GOAL, it'll be one of [FG_MISS, FG_MADE, FG_BLOCK, ABORTED, PENALTY].
If decision = PUNT, it'll be one of [PUNT, ABORTED, PENALTY].

AllHypotheticalOutcomes.title: AllHypotheticalOutcomes

yardLine.description: The yardLine for the given hypothetical yardsToGo

PointAfterTouchdownPossibleOutcomes.title: PointAfterTouchdownPossibleOutcomes

recommendation.description: The recommendation based on the hypothetical outcomes

xpYardLine.description: The yardline where the ball would be kicked if the team went for extra point.

twoPointYardLine.description: The yardline where the ball would be snapped if the team went for two point conversion.

coachDecision.description:
The coach's decision for the play we are recommending.
Fake extra point will be considered coach's decision = GO_FOR_TWO.
Aborted extra point will still be coach's decision = XP.

playType.description:
The play type of the play after what actually happened.
Not played out penalty no plays like False Start and Defensive Offsides will have playType=PENALTY.
If decision = XP, it'll be one of [XP, PENALTY].
If decision = GO_FOR_TWO, it'll be one of [PASS, RUSH, PENALTY].

playOutcome.description:
The outcome of the play after what actually happened.
If it's a no play penalty that results in a redo of the play, playOutcome = PENALTY.
If decision = XP , it'll be one of [XP_MADE, XP_MISS, XP_BLOCK, ABORTED, PENALTY]
If decision = GO_FOR_TWO, it'll be one of [SUCCESS, FAIL, PENALTY] where success = a successful two point conversion.

PointAfterTouchdownHypotheticalOutcomes.description: The hypothetical outcome probabilities and expected values for the point after touchdown across 5 scenarios (defense 15 yard penalty, defense 5 yard penalty, no penalty, offense 5 yard penalty, offense 10 yard penalty, offense 15 yard penalty)
PointAfterTouchdownHypotheticalOutcomes.title: PointAfterTouchdownHypotheticalOutcomes

PlayWithPointAfterTouchdownPossibleOutco.title: PlayWithPointAfterTouchdownPossibleOutcomes

get.description:
The tracking data from a game for a player in a range. Either gameId or gameKey is required.
The returned tracking data will contain every timeslice for the player, regardless of whether they were on or off the field.
There is a limit of 30 seconds max for the difference between the startTime and the endTime parameters.
Note: if the range requested fits within a GSIS play, it is more performant to use /tracking/game/player/play and filter down instead.

The tracking data from a game for a team on a play. Note that either a gameId or a gameKey is required.
Note this returns all tracking data (on and off field) for the participants on this play with the specified team.

get.description:
The tracking data from a game for a team in a range. Either a gameId or gameKey is required.
The returned tracking data will contain every timeslice for the team, regardless of whether they were on or off the field.
There is a limit of 30 seconds max for the difference between the startTime and the endTime parameters.
Note: if the range requested fits within a GSIS play, it is more performant to use /tracking/game/team/play and filter down instead.

The tracking data from a game for a team after a specific play for 30 seconds or up until the next play, whichever is shorter. Either a gameId or a gameKey is required.
Note: The data that is returned is for this teams' players on the field with a buffer of 1 yards [x: (-1, 121) and y: (-1, 54.33)], regardless of their participation.

The tracking data from a play in a game.  Note that either gameId or gameKey must be supplied.
Note this returns all player tracking data (on field and off field) for the participants on this play.

The players and ball tracking data from a play in a game.  Note that either gameId or gameKey must be supplied. Note: this returns both on field and off field tracking data for the participants in this play.

The minimal players and ball tracking data from a play in a game. Note that either gameId or gameKey must be supplied. Note: this returns both on field and off field tracking data for the participants in this play.

The minimal players and ball tracking data from a play in a game. Note that either gameId or gameKey must be supplied. Note: this returns both on field and off field tracking data for the participants in this play.

The tracking data from a game for a specified range. Either gameId or gameKey is required. This is useful for finding a range of data for the participants on the provided playId.
There is a limit of 30 seconds max for the difference between the startTime and the endTime parameters.
Note: This returns all tracking data for the range, both on field and off field.

parameters.name: startTime

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: The end time of the range, formatted as a UTC timestamp

get.description:
The tracking data from a game for a player in a range. Note that either gameId or gameKey is required. This will return for all players tracked, regardless of whether they were on the field or not.
There is a limit of 30 seconds max for the difference between the startTime and the endTime parameters.
This endpoint is useful for when trying to pull data for all players through the entirety of the game.

The tracking data from a game for a team after a specific play for 30 seconds or up until the next play, whichever is shorter. Either a gameId or a gameKey is required.
Note: The data that is returned is for players on the field with a buffer of 1 yards [x: (-1, 121) and y: (-1, 54.33)], regardless of their participation.
The ball tracking data from a play in a game.  Note that either gameId or gameKey must be supplied.
The count of tracking data for different types of messages in a game. Note that either gameId or gameKey is required.

The summary of the ball flight on a play.  Contains metrics about the ball that comes post-flight out of the tracking system.
Note:  not all plays will have ball flight summary data.  The ball must be thrown and land in order for this to be generated.  Field goals, throwaways, and short dump passes may not qualify.  If no ball data is available, flightType will be "SUMMARY_NOT_AVAILABLE"

The tracking data from a game for the objects (down markers, pylon's, etc.) in a range. Note that either gameId or gameKey is required. This will return for all objects tracked, regardless of whether they were on the field or not.

Returns data for separation to QB on pass rush that allows rendering of a separation chart. Returns back data for all individual defenders that pass rushed for at least 1 play in the game, any further filtering can be done at the client. Averages out their separation to the QB if they were the closest to the QB for the play.

leagueAverage.description: Note: this average is done as an All-Time average, covering the lifespan of when this metric has been built via NGS

leagueMinSeparation.description: Note: this average is done as an All-Time minimum, covering the lifespan of when this metric has been built via NGS

leagueMaxSeparation.description: Note: this average is done as an All-Time maximum, covering the lifespan of when this metric has been built via NGS

get.description: Returns comprehensive information for all players involved in a play.

formation.description: A string constant of the base formation, can be one of "EMPTY", "I_FORM", "JUMBO", "SHOTGUN", "SINGLEBACK", "WILDCAT".

playClockAtSnap.description: The play clock at the time of snap

timeBetweenHuddleBreakAndSnap.description: The number of milliseconds between the huddle break and snap.

timeBetweenPreviousPlayToSnap.description: The number of milliseconds between the end of the previous play and the start of this play. Note that if the previous play is a non-playtime play or if the prior play was the opposing team's possession, then this value will not be set.

nonTrackingPassProbability.description: The probability this play was going to be a passing play. This is determined via non-tracking data situational features, such as down, distance, time left, yards to go, etc.

trackingPassProbability.description: The probability this play was going to be a passing play. This is determined via the same features as the nonTrackingPassProbability, but also includes player tracking data.

qbAlignment.description: A string constant, can be one of [SHOTGUN, PISTOL, WILDCAT, UNDER_CENTER, UNKNOWN]

get.description:
Returns the latest platform events based on the provided parameter. Note that a timestamp is required for consuming the API. Also note that this endpoint is not meant to be a polling endpoint, but rather a supplemental endpoint in case a callback is missed. Please consult the NGS team for on-boarding on correction callbacks.

Events are only retained for 1 week.

type.description: The event type of this event

eventTime.description: The UTC timestamp this event occurred

gameId.description: This will exist in almost every response

gameKey.description: This will exist in every response that has a gameId

playId.description: This will exist for every response that involes a play

nflId.description: The affected player, this will only exist for PLAYER_PERFORMANCE_NULLIFIED, PLAYER_PERFORMANCE_ENABLED, PARTICIPATION_UPDATED

changeType.description: This only exists for EVENT_CHANGED, GAME_EVENT, and PARTICIPATION_UPDATED, represents how the data was changed.

eventId.description: This only exists for EVENT_CHANGED and GAME_EVENT. References a unique id for the event in a game

name.description: This only exists for EVENT_CHANGED and GAME_EVENT. References the name of the event

time.description: This only exists for EVENT_CHANGED and GAME_EVENT. References the latest time of the event

oldState.description: This only exists for PLAY_STATE_CHANGED. References the old playState

newState.description: This only exists for PLAY_STATE_CHANGED. References the new playState

submittedPlay.description: This will only exist for PLAY_WINDOW_CHANGED and TRACKING_DATA_RECREATED

startEventTime.description: This is the first event in the play, usually a huddle or line set

startPlayTime.description: This is the first event during play time, typically the snap or kickoff

endPlayTime.description: This is the last event during play time, effectively when the whistle is blown and the play is dead

endEventTime.description: This is the last event in the play. This accounts for situations where penalties or other non-play events occur after the whistle

gameEventSource.description: We pull events from different sources, 'video' is based on frame by frame video analysis, while 'zebra' is what is sent from the venue

play.description: This will only exist for any events that have a play associated with it

siteAlert.description: This will only exist for SITE_ALERT_CREATED, SITE_ALERT_REMOVED

affectedTeams.description: The teamIds that this alert affects

message.description: A human readable message of the alert

post.description: An endpoint to send a single event in a game. This action will do an upsert.

put.description: An endpoint to update an event in a game.

timeUpdate.description: This value is now deprecated. The time will always be updated based on the offset of each event

post.description: An endpoint to send all available events for a game.

delete.description: An endpoint to delete a single event in a game.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the event defined by the NGS Glossary

parameters.name: qbAlignment
parameters.description:
Whether or not to group data by the qb alignment which can be defined as `UNDER_CENTER`, `SHOTGUN`, `PISTOL`, or `WILDCAT`.
  - When the qb is not lined up as a qb then the alignment is `WILDCAT`.
  - When the qb is under the center then the alignment is `UNDER_CENTER`.
  - When the qb is not under the center and there are one to many skill players behind the qb then the alignment
    is `PISTOL`.
  - When the qb is not under the center and there are no skill players behind the qb then the alignment is
    `SHOTGUN`.

parameters.name: backfieldPlayerCount
parameters.description: Whether or not to group data by the backfield player count. The backfield player count is defined by the number of players in the backfield.

parameters.name: receiverAlignment
parameters.description: Whether or not to group data by the receiver alignment. The receiver alignment is defined as the count of the eligible receivers for the left and right side indicating the number of receivers on each side by `(greater number)x(lower number)` i.e. (`3x1` or `2x2`). The larger number is always on the left side regardless of which side the receivers are on to account for mirroring.

get.description: Defensive Statistics in season and seasonType that can be grouped by any combination of the qbAlignment, backfieldPlayerCount, and receiverAlignment with filters applied. Because of the dynamic nature of the groupings, the response will return an array of formations aggregated according to the groupings given with the grouping applied.

parameters.name: quarter

Quarters in a game: (1,2,3,4,5). Defaults to all.
 - Single select: quarter=1

Downs in a game: (1,2,3,4). Defaults to all.

 - Multi select with comma separated list: yardsToGo=1-2,3-6

parameters.name: fieldPosition
parameters.description:
Position on the field where play is occurring.  Defaults to all.
 - RED_ZONE - plays in the red zone.
 - IN_THE_FIELD - plays outside of the red zone.

parameters.name: coverageType
parameters.description:
Defense coverage group types:
 - groups by Man or Zone ["MAN", "ZONE"]
 - groups by Safety Shell: ["SINGLE_HIGH", "SPLIT_SAFETY", "COVER_0"]
 - groups by Coverage Type: ["COVER_0", "COVER_1", "2_MAN", "COVER_2", "COVER_3", "COVER_4", "COVER_6", "PREVENT"]

parameters.name: qbAlignment
parameters.description:
Whether or not to group data by the qb alignment which can be defined as `UNDER_CENTER`, `SHOTGUN`, `PISTOL`, or `WILDCAT`.
  - When the qb is not lined up as a qb then the alignment is `WILDCAT`.
  - When the qb is under the center then the alignment is `UNDER_CENTER`.
  - When the qb is not under the center and there are one to many skill players behind the qb then the alignment
    is `PISTOL`.
  - When the qb is not under the center and there are no skill players behind the qb then the alignment is
    `SHOTGUN`.

parameters.name: backfieldPlayerCount
parameters.description: Whether or not to group data by the backfield player count. The backfield player count is defined by the number of players in the backfield.

parameters.name: receiverAlignment
parameters.description: Whether or not to group data by the receiver alignment. The receiver alignment is defined as the count of the eligible receivers for the left and right side indicating the number of receivers on each side by `(greater number)x(lower number)` i.e. (`3x1` or `2x2`). The larger number is always on the left side regardless of which side the receivers are on to account for mirroring.

get.description: Receiver Statistics in season and seasonType that can be grouped by any combination of the qbAlignment, backfieldPlayerCount, and receiverAlignment with filters applied. Because of the dynamic nature of the groupings, the response will return an array of formations aggregated according to the groupings given with the grouping applied.

parameters.name: playState
parameters.description:
The minimum playState to allow for aggregation of stats.  Defaults to UNOFFICIAL, the order and values for playState are
 - NGS_GENERATED - when NGS generates the play and play stats
 - UNOFFICIAL - when the official GSIS play has come in paired-with in-venue events
 - VENUE_AUDITED - when in-venue event corrections come in but not video events
 - AUDITED - when video events are complete
 - APPROVED - when the play has been QA approved

parameters.name: quarter
parameters.description:
Quarters in a game: (1,2,3,4,5). Defaults to all.
 - Single select: quarter=1
 - Multi select with comma separated list: quarter=1,2,3

parameters.name: down
parameters.description:
Downs in a game: (1,2,3,4). Defaults to all.
 - Single select: down=1
 - Multi select with comma separated list: down=1,2,3

parameters.name: yardsToGo
parameters.description:
yardsToGo ranges: (1-2, 3-6, 7+). Defaults to all.
 - Single select: yardsToGo=1-2
 - Multi select with comma separated list: yardsToGo=1-2,3-6

parameters.name: fieldPosition
parameters.description:
Position on the field where play is occurring.  Defaults to all.
 - RED_ZONE - plays in the red zone.
 - IN_THE_FIELD - plays outside of the red zone.

parameters.name: coverageType
parameters.description:
Defense coverage group types:
 - groups by Man or Zone ["MAN", "ZONE"]
 - groups by Safety Shell: ["SINGLE_HIGH", "SPLIT_SAFETY", "COVER_0"]
 - groups by Coverage Type: ["COVER_0", "COVER_1", "2_MAN", "COVER_2", "COVER_3", "COVER_4", "COVER_6", "PREVENT"]

parameters.description: The NFL ID of the player

parameters.description: The play type. this can be a single value or a list of comma delimited values (i.e. play_type_pass,play_type_sack or play_type_rush)

parameters.name: yardsToGo
parameters.description: Yards to go as given by a value or a range of values (i.e. 1, 0-2, ...)

parameters.name: qbAlignment
parameters.description:
Whether or not to group data by the qb alignment which can be defined as `UNDER_CENTER`, `SHOTGUN`, `PISTOL`, or `WILDCAT`.
  - When the qb is not lined up as a qb then the alignment is `WILDCAT`.
  - When the qb is under the center then the alignment is `UNDER_CENTER`.
  - When the qb is not under the center and there are one to many skill players behind the qb then the alignment
    is `PISTOL`.
  - When the qb is not under the center and there are no skill players behind the qb then the alignment is
    `SHOTGUN`.

parameters.name: backfieldPlayerCount
parameters.description: Whether or not to group data by the backfield player count. The backfield player count is defined by the number of players in the backfield.

parameters.name: receiverAlignment
parameters.description: Whether or not to group data by the receiver alignment. The receiver alignment is defined as the count of the eligible receivers for the left and right side indicating the number of receivers on each side by `(greater number)x(lower number)` i.e. (`3x1` or `2x2`). The larger number is always on the left side regardless of which side the receivers are on to account for mirroring.

get.description: Returns stats by offensive formations for the specified player that can be grouped by any combination of the qbAlignment, backfieldPlayerCount, and receiverAlignment with filters applied. Because of the dynamic nature of the groupings, the response will return an array of formations aggregated according to the groupings given with the grouping applied.. Note that this is simply a player agnostic wrapper to /v2/qb/stats/formation/season, /v2/rb/stats/formation/season, and /v2/receiver/stats/formation/season

parameters.description: The NFL.com generated ID for a player

parameters.description: The GSIS generated ID for a player

parameters.name: playState
parameters.description:
The minimum playState to allow for aggregation of stats.  Defaults to AUDITED, the order and values for playState are
 - NGS_GENERATED - when NGS generates the play and play stats
 - UNOFFICIAL - when the official GSIS play has come in paired-with in-venue events
 - VENUE_AUDITED - when in-venue event corrections come in but not video events
 - AUDITED - when video events are complete
 - APPROVED - when the play has been QA approved

NGS_GENERATED refers to an initial set of play stats generated by the NGS Platform UNOFFICIAL refers to the initial data when a play first comes in AUDITED refers to when we've attached a more exact series of events to the play APPROVED is when the play has been manually validated and approved

get.description: Returns team defense stats based on the filter grouped teams

Returns a list of matchup rankings for home and visiting teams. Z-differentials are always from the offensive perspective. For example, `teamPassingDeepZDiff` = `team.teamPassingDeepZ` - `opponentTeam.teamDefensePassingDeepZ`. Likewise, the advantage is also from the offensive perspective where positive ratings are the offense's advantage and the negative ratings are the defense's advantage. Zero denotes no advantage on either side. Returns a list of matchup rankings for home and visiting teams.

parameters.name: seasonType
parameters.description: Options are ["REG", "POST"] and can be a list separated by commas.

parameters.name: weekSlug
parameters.description:
```
The NFL week name:
- Regular season weeks are denoted as [WEEK_1, WEEK_2, ... WEEK_18]
- Post season weeks are denoted as ["WC",  "DIV",  "CONF",  "SB"]
Can be a list separated by commas.
```

get.description: Returns a list of plays that match the provided parameters. This endpoint is experimental. Access is restricted.

parameters.name: playState
parameters.description:
The minimum playState to allow for aggregation of stats.  Defaults to UNOFFICIAL, the order and values for playState are
 - NGS_GENERATED - when NGS generates the play and play stats
 - UNOFFICIAL - when the official GSIS play has come in paired-with in-venue events
 - VENUE_AUDITED - when in-venue event corrections come in but not video events
 - AUDITED - when video events are complete
 - APPROVED - when the play has been QA approved

parameters.name: quarter
parameters.description:
Quarters in a game: (1,2,3,4,5). Defaults to all.
 - Single select: quarter=1
 - Multi select with comma separated list: quarter=1,2,3

parameters.name: down
parameters.description:
Downs in a game: (1,2,3,4). Defaults to all.
 - Single select: down=1
 - Multi select with comma separated list: down=1,2,3

parameters.name: yardsToGo
parameters.description:
yardsToGo ranges: (1-2, 3-6, 7+). Defaults to all.
 - Single select: yardsToGo=1-2
 - Multi select with comma separated list: yardsToGo=1-2,3-6

parameters.name: fieldPosition
parameters.description:
Position on the field where play is occurring.  Defaults to all.
 - RED_ZONE - plays in the red zone.
 - IN_THE_FIELD - plays outside of the red zone.

parameters.name: coverageType
parameters.description:
Defense coverage group types:
 - groups by Man or Zone ["MAN", "ZONE"]
 - groups by Safety Shell: ["SINGLE_HIGH", "SPLIT_SAFETY", "COVER_0"]
 - groups by Coverage Type: ["COVER_0", "COVER_1", "2_MAN", "COVER_2", "COVER_3", "COVER_4", "COVER_6", "PREVENT"]

get.description: Returns defensive stats for the pass rushers in the game

sackRate.description: The ratio of sacks to blitzes

passRushPct.description: The percent of snaps played vs total team snaps

hurries.description: The number of times defender caused a QB Hurry

hurryRate.description: The ratio of hurries to blitz attempts

pressureCausedTurnover.description: The number of pressures that resulted in a turnover

doubleTeamCount.description: The number of times defender was double teamed

doubleTeamPct.description: The percent of snaps defender was double teamed

quickPressureCount.description: The number of times defender had quick pressure

avgTimeToPressure.description: the mean of time to pressure value

positiveRushCount.description: the count of plays where defender was a pass rusher and average pressure probability was greater than pressure probability at snap

negativeRushCount.description: the count of plays where defender was a pass rusher and average pressure probability was less than pressure probability at snap

positiveRushPct.description: the ratio of positive rush count to negative rush count

avgPressureProbabilityAtSnap.description: the mean of the pressure probability assigned to the player at snap

avgPressureProbability.description: the mean of the average pressure probability achieved by a player over the course of a dropback

avgPeakPressureProbability.description: the mean of the maximum pressure probability achieved by a player over the course of a dropback

avgPressureProbabilityOverExpected.description: the mean of the difference between average pressure probability and pressure probability at snap

avgTimeToSack.description: the mean of time to sack value

 - UNOFFICIAL - when the official GSIS play has come in paired-with in-venue events
 - VENUE_AUDITED - when in-venue event corrections come in but not video events
 - AUDITED - when video events are complete
 - APPROVED - when the play has been QA approved

get.description: Check on the status of a game simulation. This will return the current runtime of the game simulation and the runtime of the data deletion job if they're actively running.

isActive.description: True if the job exists, false otherwise

isComplete.description: True if the job has finished, false otherwise

startTime.description: The startTime of the job, in UTC, formatted in ISO8601 form.

runTime.description: The number of milliseconds since the startTime that the job has ran

isActive.description: True if the job exists, false otherwise

isComplete.description: True if the job has finished, false otherwise

startTime.description: The startTime of the job, in UTC, formatted in ISO8601 form.

runTime.description: The number of milliseconds since the startTime that the job has ran

post.description: Kicks off the job to clear out data for the provided game. An appropriate error will be returned if there is a job already running or a simulation already running for the game

latency.description: A configurable value to speed up a simulation. This defaults to 10 which effectively plays the simulation at 1.1x speed. The value represents the number of milliseconds to shave off a second of time.

minsBeforeKickoff.description: The number of minutes before the kickoff to start the simulation. This defaults to 10 mins. Note that setting this to 0 does not mean that the simulation will start at the moment the ball was kicked off, but rather the scheduled kickoff time.

post.description: Starts the game simulation for the provided game

delete.description: Immediately stops the game simulation for the provided game

info.title: NFL Next Gen Stats API
info.description:
API providing NGS data in the following categories:
- League Data (Schedules, Rosters, etc.)
- League Averages
- Tracking Data
- Player Participation and Performance
- Team Participation and Performance
- Leaders
- Heatmaps
- Charts
- Game Schematics and Splits
- Alerts

API Versions will be handled using Accept-Version headers. If new versions of the API become available throughout the season, the changelog and version number will be updated on this page.

Corrections and Callbacks

The NGS platform can notify clients when specific events happen within the platform. This includes things such as (but not limited to):
- Play/Game Data Availability
- Event Changes
- Alerts from the NGS Team

Documentation is available to understand how this integration works. Please consult the NGS Support Team for getting onboarded with the callback system.

Streaming API

The NGS Platform also provides a Streaming API to have realtime tracking data pushed to clients. Separate documentation is available for this level of integration.

Note: If integrating for the first time, please consult with the NGS Support Team on proper integration during development and before going live.
